title: 10 things to know before investing
summary: It’s important to not invest in the market based on emotions, such as fear or greed. Don’t buy and sell your investments too soon, you could miss out on significant gains. Check your ego at the door and understand that you’ll make mistakes along the way. Resilience is key when investing in the stock market is a risky proposition that can lead to significant gains over the long-term. It's important to have some resilience when dealing with the inevitable bumps in the road.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The stock market has been a great source of wealth creation for many investors. Over the past decade, the S&P 500 index alone has created more than 200% value appreciation for its long-term investors. However, investing in the stock market is not as simple as buying stocks and forgetting about them for 10 or 20 years. It requires constant monitoring, research, and analysis to identify the right opportunities and manage risk. The Great Recession of 2007-08 is a perfect example of how risky investing can be. Many people who were new to investing suffered significant losses when their investments tanked during that time. If you\u2019re thinking about investing your money in stocks, here are 10 things you need to know before doing so."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Know what you\u2019re investing in"),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s important to know what you\u2019re investing in, particularly when you\u2019re new to investing and don\u2019t have much experience in the area. You don\u2019t want to invest in something that you don\u2019t fully understand. If you invest in something that you don\u2019t fully understand, you\u2019re more likely to make bad investment decisions. This can lead to significant losses. Understanding what you\u2019re investing in is a crucial first step towards successful investing. Once you understand the basics of each type of investment, you can then go on to research specific companies to determine if they\u2019re a good investment."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t invest in emotions"),mdx("p",null,"Investing in the stock market is a great way to build your wealth over time. However, it\u2019s not the right choice for everyone. Investing in the stock market is a long-term investment that requires patience and discipline. It\u2019s important to not invest in the market based on emotions, such as fear or greed. For example, if you become scared during a financial crisis and sell your investments too soon, you could miss out on significant gains. Alternatively, if you\u2019re greedy and try to time the market by buying and selling too frequently, you\u2019re more likely to make bad choices that could cost you money in the long run. It\u2019s important to invest in the stock market for the long haul and avoid letting your emotions get the best of you."),mdx("h2",null,"Check your ego at the door"),mdx("p",null,"Investing in the stock market can be a humbling experience. It\u2019s important to check your ego at the door and understand that you\u2019ll make mistakes along the way. No one is perfect. Everyone makes mistakes. If you don\u2019t make mistakes, you\u2019re either not taking enough risks or you\u2019re being reckless with your money. Mistakes are an essential part of the learning process when it comes to investing. The only way to learn and improve is to make mistakes and learn from them. If you don\u2019t make mistakes, you\u2019re unlikely to improve. You can\u2019t expect to make money in the stock market if you don\u2019t accept that you\u2019ll make mistakes along the way."),mdx("h2",null,"Commission, fees, and margin rates"),mdx("p",null,"Before you invest in a particular stock, it\u2019s important to understand what impact commission rates and fees will have on your investment. Different brokers charge different rates for their services. If you\u2019re buying and selling stocks frequently, these costs can add up and erode your profit margin. In addition to commissions, some brokers also charge a fee for holding your investments in their account. Before you invest in a particular stock, make sure you understand what impact the fees will have on your investment. In addition to commissions and fees, it\u2019s also important to understand margin rates. When you borrow money to invest in the stock market, you\u2019re using margin. Your broker will calculate the margin rate based on various factors, such as the current interest rate environment."),mdx("h2",null,"A look at the bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"Before you invest in a particular stock, it\u2019s important to look at the company\u2019s earnings and cash flows to determine if it\u2019s a good investment opportunity. You can find this information by doing a quick Google search or by investing in research tools and financial websites. Make sure you check the most recent earnings and cash flow figures. Today\u2019s earnings are what matter, not yesterday\u2019s figures. If you\u2019re not sure how to interpret these figures, consider hiring an investment advisor. They can help you make sense of the figures and determine if a particular stock is a good investment opportunity."),mdx("h2",null,"Resilience is key"),mdx("p",null,"Investing in the stock market is a risky proposition that can lead to significant gains over the long term. However, it\u2019s important to have some resilience when dealing with the inevitable bumps in the road along the way. It\u2019s likely that you\u2019ll experience multiple losses along the way. You may even experience some significant losses, particularly if you\u2019re new to investing and are investing in the stock market for the first time. Make sure you remain resilient and don\u2019t sell your investments too soon. It can be tempting to sell when times get tough, but you need to resist that temptation and keep the faith. You\u2019ll likely see significant gains in the long run once these investments recover."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t rely on just one source of research"),mdx("p",null,"While it\u2019s important to understand the basics behind each type of investment and the earnings and cash flow figures, you should also do some additional research on top of this. It\u2019s important to diversify your research and use multiple sources. You can\u2019t put all of your eggs in one basket. It\u2019s important to not rely on just one source of research when making investment decisions. You can\u2019t control the quality of the information that you receive. There\u2019s no way to know if the information you\u2019re receiving is accurate. It\u2019s important to use multiple sources of research so that you can diversify and mitigate your risk."),mdx("h2",null,"Summing up"),mdx("p",null,"The stock market has been a great source of wealth creation for many investors. However, investing in the stock market is not as simple as buying stocks and forgetting about them for 10 or 20 years. It requires constant monitoring, research, and analysis to identify the right opportunities and manage risk. It\u2019s important to know what you\u2019re investing in, don\u2019t invest in emotions, check your ego at the door, and check the earnings and cash flow figures. It\u2019s also important to use multiple sources of research and have some resilience when dealing with the inevitable bumps in the road along the way."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Pick the Right Investments for You
How to Start Investing with Little Money

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Unless you\u2019re a trust fund kid or a lottery winner, chances are that you don\u2019t have much cash to invest. As a recent college graduate with student loans and rent to pay, let alone the prospect of saving for retirement, you may think investing feels like an impossible task. But it doesn\u2019t have to be. You just need to know where to start.
Investing can be intimidating at first glance. Even high-net-worth individuals struggle finding trustworthy advisors who specialize in helping those with little capital get started in the market\u2014until now. The following simple strategies will help any investor begin investing with little money and see returns over time. Keep reading for more details and examples of how much you could stand to gain from investing even a small amount now and maintaining that habit for the long term.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Investing for Income - Generating Passive Income

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to investing, most people think of stocks and the performance of the market. However, there are many other ways to invest your money and generate income from it. Investing for income means you\u2019re looking for a regular stream of cash from your investments, either as quarterly or annual payments. There are several ways to do this; you just need to know where to look.
Investing for income can be a challenging endeavor, but with the right knowledge you can achieve your goal. If you\u2019re looking for some steady returns on your investment, check out our guide on how to invest for income in a variety of ways that won\u2019t leave you out of pocket and will allow you to continue growing your wealth over time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Basics of Investing - What You Need to Know
Getting Started in Real Estate Investing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Real estate investing can be a very lucrative career or side gig. It may seem like a lot of work, but the truth is that it\u2019s not as difficult as you think. You\u2019ll be surprised at how simple real estate investing can be if you know what to do and where to start. If you\u2019re new to the world of real estate investing, then this blog post will help get you started down the right path.
This article will walk you through different types of real estate investments and reveal ways to get started in this market today. Even if you don\u2019t have millions of dollars lying around, there are still plenty of ways for you to get your feet wet in the world of real estate investing without breaking the bank.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Investing for Retirement

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The quality of life for most people in their golden years is directly correlated to how well they prepared for retirement. According to a recent report by the National Institute on Retirement Security, as many as one-third of Americans are at risk of being unable to maintain their current standard of living in retirement. That\u2019s because many are not putting away enough money on a regular basis.
An investment strategy that can be useful for helping you achieve your retirement goals is known as "retirement investing." This type of investing is geared toward enabling you to retire sooner with a more comfortable and secure standard of living. If you\u2019re not quite ready to retire but would like to have more financial security once you do, it\u2019s probably time to begin planning for your post-work life. A good place to start is by familiarizing yourself with the many different types of retirement investing available. Understanding these various options along with their pros and cons will help you determine which one(s) might be right for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There\u2019s a lot of mystery and fear around investing your hard-earned money. For many people, that means they never get started. But investing your money instead of just saving it can have a big impact on your financial future. In fact, time is the enemy of your money -- the sooner you begin investing for your future, the better off you\u2019ll be.
Working with as little as $10 per month or an initial investment of $100 per month, you can begin to invest for your future. While it\u2019s not necessarily easy to become a successful investor (it does take time and effort), there are simple things you can do to get started on the right foot with minimum risk. Below are 10 investing tips for beginners that will help set you on the right path toward achieving great returns on your savings:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Pick the Best Stocks for Your Portfolio

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New investors often struggle with how and where to invest their money. There are so many stock marketplaces, brokerages, and investment options that it can be overwhelming. However, picking the right stocks is important\u2014your portfolio will largely be made up of stocks for a reason. The market may fluctuate rapidly, but your financial future rests on sound investments.
Let\u2019s take a look at some tips for picking the best stocks for your portfolio in any market. Your stock portfolio may seem like an unchangeable part of your financial plan, but it\u2019s actually one of the most flexible components. Once you know what kind of risk profile you\u2019re comfortable with and which industries or sectors you want to invest in, you\u2019ll have a clearer picture of what kind of stocks to buy. Here\u2019s what you need to know about picking the best stocks for your portfolio:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Exchange Traded Funds - A Beginner's Guide

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The global financial crisis, which began in 2007 and is still lingering almost a decade later, has left many investors wary of stocks as an asset class. The collapse of several large banks and financial institutions, coupled with the housing market crash, has led many to question whether the stock market is a safe place for their money.
The answer is yes \u2013 provided you choose the right stocks. In fact, investing in stocks can be one of the safest ways to build your wealth over time. So if you\u2019re wary about putting your money in individual companies or prefer less risky investments, ETFs may be an ideal option for you. Read on to learn more about these exchange-traded funds and whether or not they could be good for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
